intro: Sphaerostephanos hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy stephanos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in grassy areas and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
